briefdescription.para: Table shows attributes from features in a vector layer.
Table shows attributes from the current atlas feature.
Table shows attributes from related child features.
Specifies the content source for the attribute table.
Current vector layer, if in atlas feature mode.
Data defined vector layer - only.
Feature filter expression.
True if feature filtering enabled.
Shows only the features that intersect the current atlas feature.
Associated map (used to display the visible features)
Maximum number of features that is displayed.
Relation id, if in relation children mode.
Shows only the features that are visible in the associated layout map (true by default)
True if only unique rows should be shown.
Attribute source.
Associated vector layer.
Constructor for QgsLayoutItemAttributeTable, attached to the specified layout.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership is transferred to the layout.

briefdescription.para: This method needs to be reimplemented in all classes which implement this interface and return an expression context.
Returns the multiframe display name.
Returns true if the table is set to show only features visible on a corresponding map item.
Returns the current expression used to filter features for the table.

detaileddescription.para: The filter is only active if filterFeatures() is true.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a feature filter is active on the attribute table.
Returns true if the table is set to only show features which intersect the current atlas feature.
Called after all pending items have been restored from XML.

detaileddescription.para:
Multiframes can use this method to run steps which must take place after all items have been restored to the layout, such as connecting to signals emitted by other items, which may not have existed in the layout at the time readXml() was called. E.g. a scalebar can use this to connect to its linked map item after restoration from XML.
readXml()

briefdescription.para: Queries the attribute table's vector layer for attributes to show in the table.

simplesect.para: true if attributes were successfully fetched

briefdescription.para: Returns the item's icon.
Returns the layout map whose extents are controlling the features shown in the table.

detaileddescription.para:
The extents of the map are only used if displayOnlyVisibleFeatures() is true.
setMap()
displayOnlyVisibleFeatures()

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum number of features to be shown by the table.
Refreshes a data defined property for the multi frame by reevaluating the property's value and redrawing the item with this new value.

detaileddescription.para: If property is set to QgsLayoutObject::AllProperties then all data defined properties for the item will be refreshed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the relation id which the table displays child features from.

simplesect.para: Only used if table source() is set to RelationChildren.

briefdescription.para: Resets the attribute table's columns to match the vector layer's fields.
Sets the attributes to display in the table.

parameterdescription.para: list of fields names from the vector layer to show. Set to an empty list to show all feature attributes.

set to true to force the table to refetch features from its vector layer and immediately update the display of the table. This may result in the table changing size to accommodate the new displayed feature attributes.

briefdescription.para: Sets the attribute table to only show features which are visible in a map item.

detaileddescription.para: Changing this setting forces the table to refetch features from its vector layer, and may result in the table changing size to accommodate the new displayed feature attributes.

briefdescription.para: Sets the expression used for filtering features in the table.

detaileddescription.para: The filter is only active if filterFeatures() is set to true. Changing this setting forces the table to refetch features from its vector layer, and may result in the table changing size to accommodate the new displayed feature attributes.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the feature filter is active for the attribute table.

detaileddescription.para:
Changing this setting forces the table to refetch features from its vector layer, and may result in the table changing size to accommodate the new displayed feature attributes.
filterFeatures()
setFeatureFilter()

briefdescription.para: Sets attribute table to only show features which intersect the current atlas feature.
Sets a layout map to use to limit the extent of features shown in the attribute table.

detaileddescription.para:
This setting only has an effect if setDisplayOnlyVisibleFeatures is set to true. Changing the map forces the table to refetch features from its vector layer, and may result in the table changing size to accommodate the new displayed feature attributes.
map()
setDisplayOnlyVisibleFeatures

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum number of features shown by the table.

detaileddescription.para:
Changing this setting may result in the attribute table changing its size to accommodate the new number of rows, and requires the table to refetch features from its vector layer.
maximumNumberOfFeatures()

briefdescription.para: Sets the relation id from which to display child features.

simplesect.para: Only used if table source() is set to RelationChildren.

briefdescription.para: Sets the source for attributes to show in table body.
Sets attribute table to only show unique rows.

detaileddescription.para: Set uniqueOnly to true to show only unique rows. Duplicate rows will be stripped from the table.

briefdescription.para: Sets the vector layer from which to display feature attributes.

detaileddescription.para: This is only considered if the table source() is LayerAttributes.

briefdescription.para: Sets a string to wrap the contents of the table cells by.

detaileddescription.para:
Occurrences of this string will be replaced by a line break.
wrapString
string to replace with line break
wrapString()

briefdescription.para: Returns the attributes used to sort the table's features.

simplesect.para: a QList of integer/bool pairs, where the integer refers to the attribute index and the bool to the sort order for the attribute. If true the attribute is sorted ascending, if false, the attribute is sorted in descending order.

briefdescription.para: Returns the source for attributes shown in the table body.
Returns the source layer for the table, considering the table source mode.

detaileddescription.para: For example, if the table is set to atlas feature mode, then the source layer will be the atlas coverage layer. If the table is set to layer attributes mode, then the source layer will be the user specified vector layer.

briefdescription.para: Returns unique multiframe type id.
Returns true if the table is set to show only unique rows.
Returns the vector layer the attribute table is currently using.

detaileddescription.para: This is only considered if the table source() is LayerAttributes.

briefdescription.para: Returns the string used to wrap the contents of the table cells by.

detaileddescription.para:
Occurrences of this string will be replaced by a line break.
setWrapString()

briefdescription.para: Returns a new QgsLayoutItemAttributeTable for the specified parent layout.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &itemElem, const QDomDocument &doc, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readPropertiesFromElement

briefdescription.para: Sets multiframe state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the multiframe
document
DOM document
context
read write context
writePropertiesToElement() Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Stores multiframe state within an XML DOM element.

parameterdescription.para: is the DOM element to store the multiframe's properties in

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of attribute indices corresponding to displayed fields in the table.

simplesect.para: kept for compatibility with 2.0 api only

briefdescription.para: Replaces occurrences of the wrap character with line breaks.
Restores a field alias map from a pre 2.4 format project file format.

parameterdescription.para: QMap of integers to strings, where the string is the alias to use for the corresponding field, and the integer is the field index from the vector layer

briefdescription.para: Checks if this vector layer will be removed (and sets mVectorLayer to 0 if yes)
A layout table subclass that displays attributes from a vector layer.
